data.title: Russians See Little Fallout After US Sanctions Hit Dollar Exchange Trade
data.meta_description: The latest round of US sanctions effectively ended three decades of daily exchange trading in the dollar for Russia’s ruble that first began in the twilight of the Soviet Union. Russians mostly took the news in stride.
data.text:
The latest round of US sanctions effectively ended three decades of daily exchange trading in the dollar for Russia’s ruble that first began in the twilight of the Soviet Union. Russians mostly took the news in stride.

The Moscow Exchange from Thursday halted trading on several markets involving dollars and euros after the company, also known as Moex, was targeted along with its settlement depository unit under US restrictions aimed at further isolating Moscow from the international financial system over its war in Ukraine. The UK followed the US with sanctions on the exchange.
